result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David E Schroeder

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Competency

2:33 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matter is before the Court for a hearing on the Defendant's Competency.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen appeared on behalf of David Schroeder.  
Mr. David Schroeder appears by video from Mendota Mental Health Institute.
**NOTE:  Mr. Schroeder is able to see the Courtroom and the parties present in the Courtroom.  
Court is not able to see Mr. Schroeder.  Staff at Mendota explain that the video cameras in the room have been damaged.  
Court asks Mr. Schreoder if he is claiming he is competent to proceed.  No response by Mr. Schroeder.  
Court asks question of Mr. Schroeder again and explains that if he does not answer, he will be deemed to be incompetent.  
Mr. Schroeder does claim to be competent.  
2:36 pm  Dr. Karyn Gust-Brey, appears by phone, is sworn and testifies on direct exam Atty Johnson.  
2:39 pm  Cross exam by Atty Grotelueschen.  
2:40 pm  Court wants to verify some of the basis for the conclusion drawn in the report.  
2:40 pm  Response by Dr. Gust-Brey to Court's questions.  Dr. Gust-Brey would recommend that he receive a protective placement for his safety and the safety of others.
2:43 pm  Questions of Dr. Gust-Brey by Attorney Grotelueschen regarding the basis for the Dr.'s recommendation.  

2:44 pm  Dr. Tetyana Kostychyna is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Johnson.  
3:04 pm  Cross exam of Dr. Kostychyna by Atty Grotelueschen.  
3:10 pm  Witness is excused.  Neither side has any other evidence to present.  
3:10 pm  Argument by Atty Grotelueschen.  
3:11 pm  Court asks:  If Corporation Counsel was ordered to be prepared for an emergency protective placement, would they already have taken in account that there is a chapter 51 in already in place.  
3:11 pm  Response by Attorney Grotelueschen.  
3:13 pm  Court finds based upon testimony of the Doctors, that the competency evaluation reports and their determination are accurate.  Mr. Schroeder is not likely to be restored to competency within the statutory period.  Court does not believe releasing him from custody is an appropriate alternative.  Court orders he be taken immediately into protective custody and remain at the facility and that Corporation Counsel look into his current placement and determine if there is a need for an emergency protective placement.  Court is ordering it be initiated by the County.  
3:17 pm  Court in recess.

2:09 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant David E Schroeder, appears by video from Mendota Mental Health Institute, with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen who is present in the Courtroom.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is before the Court for a review on the Defendant's competency to proceed.  The report has been received which indicates that the Defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competency.  Defendant believes he is competent and wants a hearing.  Court will schedule a hearing and the doctor will need to be subpoenaed to testify.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  2:12 pm  Court in recess.
Original filed with court.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
8:59 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant David E Schroeder, in custody, appearing by VIDEO from the Walworth County Jail with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  
Matter is before the Court for a competency hearing.  
Mr. Schroeder does believe he is competent and wants to have a hearing today.  
Dr. Robert Rawski is sworn by Court and testifies on exam of Attorney Johnson.  
9:14 am  Cross exam by Attorney Grotelueschen.  
9:17 am  Follow up questions of Dr. Rawski by Court.  
9:18 am  Attorney JOhnson asks that Dr. Rawski' report be made part of the record.  No objection by Attorney Grotelueschen.  Dr. Rawski's report will be made a part of the court record.  
9:19 am  Argument by Attorney Grotelueschen.  
9:19 am  Court finds defendant is not currently competent to proceed.  
He is not competent to refuse medication due to his mental illness.  
Court will commit deft to the Dept of Health Services for a period not to exceed 12 months.  
Court orders involuntary administration of mediation and treatment.  
Court will schedule a review date in approximately 90 days.  
9:22 am  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Subpoena  - R.R.
Doctor Robert Rawski

Defendant David E Schroeder in court, in custody via video from Mendota Mental Health Institute with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
Status report as to Defendant's Competency
Prisoner Release Form filed.
BOND QUASHED
Further proceedings at 02-03-2016 01:15 pm

10:02 a.m.  Court in session. Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant David E Schroeder, in custody, appearing by video from the Walworth County Jail, with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen who is present in courtroom.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was put on the calendar today because there was a request from the State to quash the defendant's bond and transfer Mr. Schroeder Menodota.  There is a a notice of a change from Winnebago County from outpatient to inpatient status - to return him to a greater level of supervision.   Attorney Johnson believes an inpatient placement would be better for Mr. Schroeder for treatment purposes.  Response by Attorney Grotelueshen.  She spoke with Mr. Schroeder and he did not have much of a response.  There is no objection to the State's request.  Court grants the request and will quash the defendant's bond.  The prisoner release form will not be sent to the Jail until arrangments have been made to transport Mr. Schroeder to Mendota.  Court is canceling tomorrow's status conference and will reschedule the status conference to next week, February 3rd at 1:15 p.m.  Court makes further record.  Clerk will arrange for Mr. Schroeder to appear by video from Mendota for the next court appearance.  If video is not available on that date, then the court date will be rescheduled.  Ms. Bohn and Asst. Corp Counsel Navis are present in Court.  Discussion concerning arrangements for transportation of Mr. Schroeder to Mendota.  Corporation Counsel's office will prepare the necessary paperwork to transfer Mr. Schroeder.  10:09 a.m.  Court in recess.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant David E Schroeder in court, in custody with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Kathilynn Grotelueschen

Defendant David E Schroeder in court, in custody with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
ADDED NO CONTACT WITH W7332 HIGHWAY 12, TOWN OF WHITEWATER.
Defendant David Schroeder present in court, in custody via video with attorney Kathilynne Grotelueschen. Daniel Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant David Schroeder present in court, in custody via video with attorney Francis Raff for bond purposes only. Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

AMENDMENT 01/13/2016: ADDED NO CONTACT WITH W7332 HIGHWAY 12, TOWN OF WHITEWATER. 

MUST POST $1000.00 CASH

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.T.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
